definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to expand/to push sth with the hand/to develop/to open up
to make a rubbing (e.g. of an inscription)
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: In other disciplines our "field work" techniques yield many trailblazing results.
sentences.chinese: 在其它領域也取得了許多先端性，開拓性的成果。

sentences.english: Professor Yin Junsheng has made the well-known pioneering contribution to the International reportage study in China.
sentences.chinese: 尹均生教授對國際報告文學的研究作了開拓性貢獻。

sentences.english: The foundation for this groundbreaking insight was built over several decades of research.
sentences.chinese: 這一極具開拓性的發現得益於幾十年研究成果的積累。

sentences.english: Master, pioneering research is reflected in the treatise of gold.
sentences.chinese: 大師開拓性的研究成果，都反映在一字千金的論著中。

sentences.english: The Initiative is a groundbreaker from many perspectives.
sentences.chinese: 該行動從許多方面來看都是開拓性的。

sentences.english: For starters, there was hardly any mention of religion.
sentences.chinese: 作爲開拓性的著作，裏面幾乎沒有提到宗教。

sentences.english: I am pleased to report that much ground-breaking activity is now under way.
sentences.chinese: 我很高興地報告，現在正在開展許多開拓性的活動。

definition: Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)
standing above the common crowd (idiom); outstanding/excellent and unrivaled
